alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Iron; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT/715 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following counties, Baraga, Iron and Marquette. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT /715 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT /515 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Michigamme, Champion, Lake Michigamme, Three Lakes, Republic, Van Riper State Park, Island Lake and Silver Lake Basin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
